ygData.subject: Problem solved
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello everyone, I have finally found the mistake I made. Between samples, the arm s speed in the simulator was not set back to 0, resulting in the arm starting

Hello everyone,

I have finally found the mistake I made. Between samples, =
the arm's 
speed in the simulator was not set back to 0, resulting in the a=
rm 
starting each sample with the kinetic energy of the last sample.
Since =
the correction of this mistake, everything works fine and NEAT 
produces ve=
ry good results. 
I want to thank everyone who tried to help me with this!
=

Thanks,
Matthias

PS: Now that I finally can evolve arm controllers, I hav=
e another 
question. To get a controller with high ability to adopt to new =

situations, would it be better to train all organisms with a high 
number =
of training samples (e.g. 15 different start goal positions) 
or with a low=
 but each generation randomly changed number of samples 
(e.g. 3 start goal=
 positions which are randomly generated each 
generation)?
